IR[%s].description: Description collection: Identity root, word n

VARIANT.description: Part variant, hardware version and production configuration

DISABLEINDEBUG.description: Disable the protection mechanism for NVM regions while in debug mode. This register will only disable the protection mechanism if the device is in debug mode.

EVENTS_DONE.description: Calibration of LFCLK RC oscillator complete event

HFCLKRUN.description: Status indicating that HFCLKSTART task has been triggered

LFCLKRUN.description: Status indicating that LFCLKSTART task has been triggered

LFCLKSRCCOPY.description: Copy of LFCLKSRC register, set when LFCLKSTART task was triggered

EVENTS_DONE.description: Calibration of LFCLK RC oscillator complete event

HFCLKSTARTED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event HFCLKSTARTED

LFCLKSTARTED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event LFCLKSTARTED

DONE.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event DONE

CTTO.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event CTTO

HFCLKSTARTED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event HFCLKSTARTED

LFCLKSTARTED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event LFCLKSTARTED

DONE.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event DONE

CTTO.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event CTTO

BYPASS.description: Enable or disable bypass of LFCLK crystal oscillator with external clock source

EXTERNAL.description: Enable or disable external source for LFCLK

CTIV.description: Calibration timer interval in multiple of 0.25 seconds. Range: 0.25 seconds to 31.75 seconds.

POWER.description: Description cluster: RAMn power control register. The RAM size will vary depending on product variant, and the RAMn register will only be present if the corresponding RAM AHB slave is present on the device.

POWERSET.description: Description cluster: RAMn power control set register

POWERCLR.description: Description cluster: RAMn power control clear register

POFWARN.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event POFWARN

SLEEPENTER.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event SLEEPENTER

SLEEPEXIT.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event SLEEPEXIT

POFWARN.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event POFWARN

SLEEPENTER.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event SLEEPENTER

SLEEPEXIT.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event SLEEPEXIT

OFF.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode when wakeup is triggered from DETECT signal from GPIO

DIF.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode when wakeup is triggered from entering into debug interface mode

POF.description: Enable or disable power failure comparator

S0POWER.description: Keep RAM section S0 ON or OFF in System ON mode.

S1POWER.description: Keep RAM section S1 ON or OFF in System ON mode.

S0RETENTION.description: Keep retention on RAM section S0 when RAM section is in OFF

S1RETENTION.description: Keep retention on RAM section S1 when RAM section is in OFF

S0POWER.description: Keep RAM section S0 of RAMn on or off in System ON mode

S1POWER.description: Keep RAM section S1 of RAMn on or off in System ON mode

S0RETENTION.description: Keep retention on RAM section S0 when RAM section is switched off

S1RETENTION.description: Keep retention on RAM section S1 when RAM section is switched off

S0POWER.description: Keep RAM section S0 of RAMn on or off in System ON mode

S1POWER.description: Keep RAM section S1 of RAMn on or off in System ON mode

S0RETENTION.description: Keep retention on RAM section S0 when RAM section is switched off

S1RETENTION.description: Keep retention on RAM section S1 when RAM section is switched off

OUTSET.description: Set individual bits in GPIO port

OUTCLR.description: Clear individual bits in GPIO port

LATCH.description: Latch register indicating what GPIO pins that have met the criteria set in the PIN_CNF[n].SENSE registers

DETECTMODE.description: Select between default DETECT signal behaviour and LDETECT mode

PIN_CNF[%s].description: Description collection: Configuration of GPIO pins

PIN0.description: Status on whether PIN0 has met criteria set in PIN_CNF0.SENSE register. Write '1' to clear.

DETECTMODE.description: Select between default DETECT signal behaviour and LDETECT mode

DIR.description: Pin direction. Same physical register as DIR register

TASKS_RSSISTART.description: Start the RSSI and take one single sample of the receive signal strength

TASKS_EDSTART.description: Start the energy detect measurement used in IEEE 802.15.4 mode

TASKS_CCASTART.description: Start the clear channel assessment used in IEEE 802.15.4 mode

EVENTS_READY.description: RADIO has ramped up and is ready to be started

EVENTS_DEVMATCH.description: A device address match occurred on the last received packet

EVENTS_DEVMISS.description: No device address match occurred on the last received packet

EVENTS_RSSIEND.description: Sampling of receive signal strength complete

EVENTS_BCMATCH.description: Bit counter reached bit count value

EVENTS_EDEND.description: Sampling of energy detection complete. A new ED sample is ready for readout from the RADIO.EDSAMPLE register

EVENTS_EDSTOPPED.description: The sampling of energy detection has stopped

EVENTS_CCAIDLE.description: Wireless medium in idle - clear to send

EVENTS_CCABUSY.description: Wireless medium busy - do not send

EVENTS_RATEBOOST.description: Ble_LR CI field received, receive mode is changed from Ble_LR125Kbit to Ble_LR500Kbit.

EVENTS_TXREADY.description: RADIO has ramped up and is ready to be started TX path

EVENTS_RXREADY.description: RADIO has ramped up and is ready to be started RX path

EVENTS_PHYEND.description: Generated when last bit is sent on air

EVENTS_CTEPRESENT.description: CTE is present (early warning right after receiving CTEInfo byte)

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

RXCRC.description: CRC field of previously received packet

DAB[%s].description: Description collection: Device address base segment n

DAP[%s].description: Description collection: Device address prefix n

DFEMODE.description: Whether to use Angle-of-Arrival (AOA) or Angle-of-Departure (AOD)

SWITCHPATTERN.description: GPIO patterns to be used for each antenna

CLEARPATTERN.description: Clear the GPIO pattern array for antenna control

DFEGPIO[%s].description: Description collection: Pin select for DFE pin n

MAXCNT.description: Maximum number of buffer words to transfer

AMOUNT.description: Number of samples transferred in the last transaction

RXCRC.description: CRC field of previously received packet

PDUSTAT.description: Status on payload length vs. PCNF1.MAXLEN

CISTAT.description: Status on what rate packet is received with in Long Range

SWITCHINGSTATE.description: Internal state of switching state machine

SAMPLINGSTATE.description: Internal state of sampling state machine

MODE.description: Radio data rate and modulation setting. The radio supports frequency-shift keying (FSK) modulation.

LFLEN.description: Length on air of LENGTH field in number of bits.

S0LEN.description: Length on air of S0 field in number of bytes.

S1LEN.description: Length on air of S1 field in number of bits.

S1INCL.description: Include or exclude S1 field in RAM

CILEN.description: Length of code indicator - long range

PLEN.description: Length of preamble on air. Decision point: TASKS_START task

CRCINC.description: Indicates if LENGTH field contains CRC or not

TERMLEN.description: Length of TERM field in Long Range operation

MAXLEN.description: Maximum length of packet payload. If the packet payload is larger than MAXLEN, the radio will truncate the payload to MAXLEN.

STATLEN.description: Static length in number of bytes

BALEN.description: Base address length in number of bytes

ENDIAN.description: On-air endianness of packet, this applies to the S0, LENGTH, S1, and the PAYLOAD fields.

ADDR0.description: Enable or disable reception on logical address 0.

ADDR1.description: Enable or disable reception on logical address 1.

ADDR2.description: Enable or disable reception on logical address 2.

ADDR3.description: Enable or disable reception on logical address 3.

ADDR4.description: Enable or disable reception on logical address 4.

ADDR5.description: Enable or disable reception on logical address 5.

ADDR6.description: Enable or disable reception on logical address 6.

ADDR7.description: Enable or disable reception on logical address 7.

LEN.description: CRC length in number of bytes.

SKIPADDR.description: Include or exclude packet address field out of CRC calculation.

DATAWHITEIV.description: Data whitening initial value. Bit 6 is hardwired to '1', writing '0' to it has no effect, and it will always be read back and used by the device as '1'.

ENA0.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 0

ENA1.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 1

ENA2.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 2

ENA3.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 3

ENA4.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 4

ENA5.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 5

ENA6.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 6

ENA7.description: Enable or disable device address matching using device address 7

CCAEDTHRES.description: CCA energy busy threshold. Used in all the CCA modes except CarrierMode.

CCACORRTHRES.description: CCA correlator busy threshold. Only relevant to CarrierMode, CarrierAndEdMode, and CarrierOrEdMode.

CCACORRCNT.description: Limit for occurances above CCACORRTHRES. When not equal to zero the corrolator based signal detect is enabled.

CTEINLINECTRLEN.description: Enable parsing of CTEInfo from received packet in BLE modes

CTEINFOINS1.description: CTEInfo is S1 byte or not

CTEERRORHANDLING.description: Sampling/switching if CRC is not OK

CTEINLINERXMODE1US.description: Spacing between samples for the samples in the SWITCHING period when CTEINLINEMODE is set

CTEINLINERXMODE2US.description: Spacing between samples for the samples in the SWITCHING period when CTEINLINEMODE is set

S0MASK.description: S0 bit mask to set which bit to match

NUMBEROF8US.description: Length of the AoA/AoD procedure in number of 8 us units

DFEINEXTENSION.description: Add CTE extension and do antenna switching/sampling in this extension

TSWITCHSPACING.description: Interval between every time the antenna is changed in the SWITCHING state

TSAMPLESPACINGREF.description: Interval between samples in the REFERENCE period

SAMPLETYPE.description: Whether to sample I/Q or magnitude/phase

TSAMPLESPACING.description: Interval between samples in the SWITCHING period when CTEINLINECTRLEN is 0

AGCBACKOFFGAIN.description: Gain will be lowered by the specified number of gain steps at the start of CTE

TSWITCHOFFSET.description: Signed value offset after the end of the CRC before starting switching in number of 16M cycles

TSAMPLEOFFSET.description: Signed value offset before starting sampling in number of 16M cycles relative to the beginning of the REFERENCE state - 12 us after switching start

SWITCHPATTERN.description: Fill array of GPIO patterns for antenna control

CLEARPATTERN.description: Clears GPIO pattern array for antenna control

MAXCNT.description: Maximum number of buffer words to transfer

AMOUNT.description: Number of samples transferred in the last transaction

POWER.description: Peripheral power control. The peripheral and its registers will be reset to its initial state by switching the peripheral off and then back on again.

EVENTS_CTS.description: CTS is activated (set low). Clear To Send.

EVENTS_NCTS.description: CTS is deactivated (set high). Not Clear To Send.

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

BAUDRATE.description: Baud rate. Accuracy depends on the HFCLK source selected.

CONFIG.description: Configuration of parity and hardware flow control

EVENTS_CTS.description: CTS is activated (set low). Clear To Send.

EVENTS_NCTS.description: CTS is deactivated (set high). Not Clear To Send.

CTS_STARTRX.description: Shortcut between event CTS and task STARTRX

NCTS_STOPRX.description: Shortcut between event NCTS and task STOPRX

CTS.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event CTS

NCTS.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event NCTS

RXDRDY.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event RXDRDY

TXDRDY.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event TXDRDY

ERROR.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event ERROR

RXTO.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event RXTO

CTS.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event CTS

NCTS.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event NCTS

TXDRDY.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TXDRDY

RXTO.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event RXTO

RXD.description: RX data received in previous transfers, double buffered

EVENTS_READY.description: TXD byte sent and RXD byte received

FREQUENCY.description: SPI frequency. Accuracy depends on the HFCLK source selected.

EVENTS_READY.description: TXD byte sent and RXD byte received

READY.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event READY
Write '1' to disable interrupt for event READY

TXD.description: TX data to send. Double buffered

EVENTS_BB.description: TWI byte boundary, generated before each byte that is sent or received

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

FREQUENCY.description: TWI frequency. Accuracy depends on the HFCLK source selected.

ADDRESS.description: Address used in the TWI transfer

EVENTS_BB.description: TWI byte boundary, generated before each byte that is sent or received

BB_SUSPEND.description: Shortcut between event BB and task SUSPEND

BB_STOP.description: Shortcut between event BB and task STOP

STOPPED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event STOPPED

RXDREADY.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event RXDREADY

TXDSENT.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event TXDSENT

ERROR.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event ERROR

BB.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event BB

SUSPENDED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event SUSPENDED

STOPPED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event STOPPED

RXDREADY.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event RXDREADY

TXDSENT.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TXDSENT

ERROR.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event ERROR

BB.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event BB

SUSPENDED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event SUSPENDED

ANACK.description: NACK received after sending the address (write '1' to clear)

DNACK.description: NACK received after sending a data byte (write '1' to clear)

ADDRESS.description: Address used in the TWI transfer

TASKS_OUT[%s].description: Description collection: Task for writing to pin specified in CONFIG[n].PSEL. Action on pin is configured in CONFIG[n].POLARITY.

TASKS_SET[%s].description: Description collection: Task for writing to pin specified in CONFIG[n].PSEL. Action on pin is to set it high.

TASKS_CLR[%s].description: Description collection: Task for writing to pin specified in CONFIG[n].PSEL. Action on pin is to set it low.

EVENTS_IN[%s].description: Description collection: Event generated from pin specified in CONFIG[n].PSEL

EVENTS_PORT.description: Event generated from multiple input GPIO pins with SENSE mechanism enabled

CONFIG[%s].description: Description collection: Configuration for OUT[n], SET[n] and CLR[n] tasks and IN[n] event

TASKS_OUT.description: Task for writing to pin specified in CONFIG[n].PSEL. Action on pin is configured in CONFIG[n].POLARITY.

TASKS_SET.description: Task for writing to pin specified in CONFIG[n].PSEL. Action on pin is to set it high.

TASKS_CLR.description: Task for writing to pin specified in CONFIG[n].PSEL. Action on pin is to set it low.

EVENTS_IN.description: Event generated from pin specified in CONFIG[n].PSEL

EVENTS_PORT.description: Event generated from multiple input GPIO pins with SENSE mechanism enabled

IN0.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event IN[0]

IN1.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event IN[1]

IN2.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event IN[2]

IN3.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event IN[3]

IN4.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event IN[4]

IN5.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event IN[5]

IN6.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event IN[6]

IN7.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event IN[7]

PORT.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event PORT

IN0.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event IN[0]

IN1.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event IN[1]

IN2.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event IN[2]

IN3.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event IN[3]

IN4.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event IN[4]

IN5.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event IN[5]

IN6.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event IN[6]

IN7.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event IN[7]

PORT.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event PORT

PSEL.description: GPIO number associated with SET[n], CLR[n] and OUT[n] tasks and IN[n] event

POLARITY.description: When In task mode: Operation to be performed on output when OUT[n] task is triggered. When In event mode: Operation on input that shall trigger IN[n] event.

OUTINIT.description: When in task mode: Initial value of the output when the GPIOTE channel is configured. When in event mode: No effect.

TASKS_START.description: Start the ADC and prepare the result buffer in RAM

TASKS_SAMPLE.description: Take one ADC sample, if scan is enabled all channels are sampled

TASKS_STOP.description: Stop the ADC and terminate any on-going conversion

EVENTS_END.description: The ADC has filled up the Result buffer

EVENTS_DONE.description: A conversion task has been completed. Depending on the mode, multiple conversions might be needed for a result to be transferred to RAM.

EVENTS_RESULTDONE.description: A result is ready to get transferred to RAM.

LIMITH.description: Description cluster: Last results is equal or above CH[n].LIMIT.HIGH

LIMITL.description: Description cluster: Last results is equal or below CH[n].LIMIT.LOW

PSELP.description: Description cluster: Input positive pin selection for CH[n]

PSELN.description: Description cluster: Input negative pin selection for CH[n]

CONFIG.description: Description cluster: Input configuration for CH[n]

LIMIT.description: Description cluster: High/low limits for event monitoring a channel

OVERSAMPLE.description: Oversampling configuration. OVERSAMPLE should not be combined with SCAN. The RESOLUTION is applied before averaging, thus for high OVERSAMPLE a higher RESOLUTION should be used.

SAMPLERATE.description: Controls normal or continuous sample rate

MAXCNT.description: Maximum number of buffer words to transfer

AMOUNT.description: Number of buffer words transferred since last START

TASKS_STOP.description: Stop the ADC and terminate any on-going conversion

EVENTS_DONE.description: A conversion task has been completed. Depending on the mode, multiple conversions might be needed for a result to be transferred to RAM.

EVENTS_RESULTDONE.description: A result is ready to get transferred to RAM.

LIMITH.description: Last results is equal or above CH[n].LIMIT.HIGH

LIMITL.description: Last results is equal or below CH[n].LIMIT.LOW

PSELN.description: Analog negative input, enables differential channel

TACQ.description: Acquisition time, the time the ADC uses to sample the input voltage

CC.description: Capture and compare value. Sample rate is 16 MHz/CC

MODE.description: Select mode for sample rate control

MAXCNT.description: Maximum number of buffer words to transfer

AMOUNT.description: Number of buffer words transferred since last START. This register can be read after an END or STOPPED event.

TASKS_CAPTURE[%s].description: Description collection: Capture Timer value to CC[n] register

EVENTS_COMPARE[%s].description: Description collection: Compare event on CC[n] match

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

BITMODE.description: Configure the number of bits used by the TIMER

TASKS_START.description: Task starting the random number generator

TASKS_STOP.description: Task stopping the random number generator

EVENTS_VALRDY.description: Event being generated for every new random number written to the VALUE register

TASKS_START.description: Task starting the random number generator

TASKS_STOP.description: Task stopping the random number generator

EVENTS_VALRDY.description: Event being generated for every new random number written to the VALUE register

VALRDY_STOP.description: Shortcut between event VALRDY and task STOP

VALRDY.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event VALRDY
Write '1' to disable interrupt for event VALRDY

TASKS_STOPECB.description: Abort a possible executing ECB operation

EVENTS_ERRORECB.description: ECB block encrypt aborted because of a STOPECB task or due to an error

TASKS_STOPECB.description: Abort a possible executing ECB operation

EVENTS_ERRORECB.description: ECB block encrypt aborted because of a STOPECB task or due to an error

ENDECB.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event ENDECB

ERRORECB.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event ERRORECB

ENDECB.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event ENDECB

ERRORECB.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event ERRORECB

ECBDATAPTR.description: Pointer to the ECB data structure (see Table 1 ECB data structure overview)

TASKS_START.description: Start resolving addresses based on IRKs specified in the IRK data structure

SCRATCHPTR.description: Pointer to data area used for temporary storage

TASKS_START.description: Start resolving addresses based on IRKs specified in the IRK data structure

END.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event END

RESOLVED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event RESOLVED

NOTRESOLVED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event NOTRESOLVED

END.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event END

RESOLVED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event RESOLVED

NOTRESOLVED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event NOTRESOLVED

STATUS.description: The IRK that was used last time an address was resolved

NIRK.description: Number of Identity root keys available in the IRK data structure

IRKPTR.description: Pointer to the IRK data structure

SCRATCHPTR.description: Pointer to a scratch data area used for temporary storage during resolution. A space of minimum 3 bytes must be reserved.

TASKS_KSGEN.description: Start generation of key-stream. This operation will stop by itself when completed.

TASKS_CRYPT.description: Start encryption/decryption. This operation will stop by itself when completed.

TASKS_RATEOVERRIDE.description: Override DATARATE setting in MODE register with the contents of the RATEOVERRIDE register for any ongoing encryption/decryption

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

CNFPTR.description: Pointer to data structure holding AES key and NONCE vector

SCRATCHPTR.description: Pointer to data area used for temporary storage

MAXPACKETSIZE.description: Length of key-stream generated when MODE.LENGTH = Extended.

TASKS_KSGEN.description: Start generation of key-stream. This operation will stop by itself when completed.

TASKS_CRYPT.description: Start encryption/decryption. This operation will stop by itself when completed.

TASKS_RATEOVERRIDE.description: Override DATARATE setting in MODE register with the contents of the RATEOVERRIDE register for any ongoing encryption/decryption

ENDKSGEN_CRYPT.description: Shortcut between event ENDKSGEN and task CRYPT

ENDKSGEN.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event ENDKSGEN

ENDCRYPT.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event ENDCRYPT

ERROR.description: Deprecated intsetfield -  Write '1' to enable interrupt for event ERROR

ENDKSGEN.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event ENDKSGEN

ENDCRYPT.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event ENDCRYPT

ERROR.description: Deprecated intclrfield -  Write '1' to disable interrupt for event ERROR

MICSTATUS.description: The result of the MIC check performed during the previous decryption operation

MODE.description: The mode of operation to be used. The settings in this register apply whenever either the KSGEN or CRYPT tasks are triggered.

DATARATE.description: Radio data rate that the CCM shall run synchronous with

CNFPTR.description: Pointer to the data structure holding the AES key and the CCM NONCE vector (see Table 1 CCM data structure overview)

SCRATCHPTR.description:
Pointer to a scratch data area used for temporary storage during key-stream generation,
        MIC generation and encryption/decryption.

MAXPACKETSIZE.description: Length of key-stream generated when MODE.LENGTH = Extended. This value must be greater or equal to the subsequent packet payload to be encrypted/decrypted.

RREN.description: Enable register for reload request registers

TIMEOUT.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event TIMEOUT
Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TIMEOUT

RUNSTATUS.description: Indicates whether or not the watchdog is running

CRV.description: Counter reload value in number of cycles of the 32.768 kHz clock

SLEEP.description: Configure the watchdog to either be paused, or kept running, while the CPU is sleeping

HALT.description: Configure the watchdog to either be paused, or kept running, while the CPU is halted by the debugger

TASKS_READCLRACC.description: Read and clear ACC and ACCDBL

EVENTS_SAMPLERDY.description: Event being generated for every new sample value written to the SAMPLE register

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

REPORTPER.description: Number of samples to be taken before REPORTRDY and DBLRDY events can be generated

ACCREAD.description: Snapshot of the ACC register, updated by the READCLRACC or RDCLRACC task

LEDPRE.description: Time period the LED is switched ON prior to sampling

ACCDBL.description: Register accumulating the number of detected double transitions

ACCDBLREAD.description: Snapshot of the ACCDBL, updated by the READCLRACC or RDCLRDBL task

EVENTS_SAMPLERDY.description: Event being generated for every new sample value written to the SAMPLE register

ENABLE.description: Enable or disable the quadrature decoder

SAMPLEPER.description: Sample period. The SAMPLE register will be updated for every new sample

REPORTPER.description: Specifies the number of samples to be accumulated in the ACC register before the REPORTRDY and DBLRDY events can be generated

ACC.description: Register accumulating all valid samples (not double transition) read from the SAMPLE register

LEDPRE.description: Period in us the LED is switched on prior to sampling

ACCDBL.description: Register accumulating the number of detected double or illegal transitions. ( SAMPLE = 2 ).

ACCDBLREAD.description: Snapshot of the ACCDBL register. This field is updated when the READCLRACC or RDCLRDBL task is triggered.

EVENTS_READY.description: COMP is ready and output is valid

REFSEL.description: Reference source select for single-ended mode

CROSS_STOP.description: Shortcut between event CROSS and task STOP

TRIGGERED4.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[4]

TRIGGERED5.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[5]

TRIGGERED6.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[6]

TRIGGERED7.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[7]

TRIGGERED8.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[8]

TRIGGERED9.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[9]

TRIGGERED10.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[10]

TRIGGERED11.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[11]

TRIGGERED12.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[12]

TRIGGERED13.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[13]

TRIGGERED14.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[14]

TRIGGERED15.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event TRIGGERED[15]

TASKS_STOP.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

TASKS_SEQSTART[%s].description: Description collection: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

TASKS_NEXTSTEP.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start if not running.

EVENTS_STOPPED.description: Response to STOP task, emitted when PWM pulses are no longer generated

EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[%s].description: Description collection: First PWM period started on sequence n

EVENTS_SEQEND[%s].description: Description collection: Emitted at end of every sequence n, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

EVENTS_PWMPERIODEND.description: Emitted at the end of each PWM period

EVENTS_LOOPSDONE.description: Concatenated sequences have been played the amount of times defined in LOOP.CNT

SHORTS.description: Shortcuts between local events and tasks

MODE.description: Selects operating mode of the wave counter

COUNTERTOP.description: Value up to which the pulse generator counter counts

LOOP.description: Number of playbacks of a loop

PTR.description: Description cluster: Beginning address in RAM of this sequence

CNT.description: Description cluster: Number of values (duty cycles) in this sequence

REFRESH.description: Description cluster: Number of additional PWM periods between samples loaded into compare register

ENDDELAY.description: Description cluster: Time added after the sequence

OUT[%s].description: Description collection: Output pin select for PWM channel n

TASKS_STOP.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

TASKS_SEQSTART.description: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

TASKS_NEXTSTEP.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start if not running.

EVENTS_STOPPED.description: Response to STOP task, emitted when PWM pulses are no longer generated

EVENTS_SEQSTARTED.description: First PWM period started on sequence n

EVENTS_SEQEND.description: Emitted at end of every sequence n, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

EVENTS_PWMPERIODEND.description: Emitted at the end of each PWM period

EVENTS_LOOPSDONE.description: Concatenated sequences have been played the amount of times defined in LOOP.CNT

SEQEND0_STOP.description: Shortcut between event SEQEND[0] and task STOP

SEQEND1_STOP.description: Shortcut between event SEQEND[1] and task STOP

LOOPSDONE_SEQSTART0.description: Shortcut between event LOOPSDONE and task SEQSTART[0]

LOOPSDONE_SEQSTART1.description: Shortcut between event LOOPSDONE and task SEQSTART[1]

LOOPSDONE_STOP.description: Shortcut between event LOOPSDONE and task STOP

STOPPED.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event STOPPED

SEQSTARTED0.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event SEQSTARTED[0]

SEQSTARTED1.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event SEQSTARTED[1]

SEQEND0.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event SEQEND[0]

SEQEND1.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event SEQEND[1]

PWMPERIODEND.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event PWMPERIODEND

LOOPSDONE.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event LOOPSDONE

STOPPED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event STOPPED

SEQSTARTED0.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event SEQSTARTED[0]

SEQSTARTED1.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event SEQSTARTED[1]

SEQEND0.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event SEQEND[0]

SEQEND1.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event SEQEND[1]

PWMPERIODEND.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event PWMPERIODEND

LOOPSDONE.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event LOOPSDONE

STOPPED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event STOPPED

SEQSTARTED0.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event SEQSTARTED[0]

SEQSTARTED1.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event SEQSTARTED[1]

SEQEND0.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event SEQEND[0]

SEQEND1.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event SEQEND[1]

PWMPERIODEND.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event PWMPERIODEND

LOOPSDONE.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event LOOPSDONE

UPDOWN.description: Selects up mode or up-and-down mode for the counter

COUNTERTOP.description: Value up to which the pulse generator counter counts. This register is ignored when DECODER.MODE=WaveForm and only values from RAM are used.

LOAD.description: How a sequence is read from RAM and spread to the compare register

MODE.description: Selects source for advancing the active sequence

CNT.description: Number of playbacks of pattern cycles

PTR.description: Beginning address in RAM of this sequence

CNT.description: Number of values (duty cycles) in this sequence
Number of additional PWM periods between samples loaded into compare register (load every REFRESH.CNT+1 PWM periods)
Time added after the sequence in PWM periods

EVENTS_END.description: The PDM has written the last sample specified by SAMPLE.MAXCNT (or the last sample after a STOP task has been received) to Data RAM

MODE.description: Defines the routing of the connected PDM microphones' signals

CLK.description: Pin number configuration for PDM CLK signal

DIN.description: Pin number configuration for PDM DIN signal

PTR.description: RAM address pointer to write samples to with EasyDMA

MAXCNT.description: Number of samples to allocate memory for in EasyDMA mode

EVENTS_END.description: The PDM has written the last sample specified by SAMPLE.MAXCNT (or the last sample after a STOP task has been received) to Data RAM

STARTED.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event STARTED

STOPPED.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event STOPPED

END.description: Enable or disable interrupt for event END

STARTED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event STARTED

STOPPED.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event STOPPED

END.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event END

STARTED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event STARTED

STOPPED.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event STOPPED

END.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event END

EDGE.description: Defines on which PDM_CLK edge Left (or mono) is sampled

GAINL.description: Left output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters) 0x00    -20 dB gain adjust 0x01  -19.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x27   -0.5 dB gain adjust 0x28      0 dB gain adjust 0x29   +0.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x4F  +19.5 dB gain adjust 0x50    +20 dB gain adjust

GAINR.description: Right output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters)

SAMPLEPTR.description: Address to write PDM samples to over DMA

BUFFSIZE.description: Length of DMA RAM allocation in number of samples

ERASEPAGE.description: Register for erasing a page in code area

ERASEPCR1.description: Deprecated register - Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

ERASEALL.description: Register for erasing all non-volatile user memory

ERASEPCR0.description: Deprecated register - Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

ERASEUICR.description: Register for erasing user information configuration registers

ERASEPAGEPARTIAL.description: Register for partial erase of a page in code area

WEN.description: Program memory access mode. It is strongly recommended to activate erase and write modes only when they are actively used.

ERASEPAGE.description: Register for starting erase of a page in code area.

ERASEPCR1.description: Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

ERASEALL.description: Erase all non-volatile memory including UICR registers. Note that the erase must be enabled using CONFIG.WEN before the non-volatile memory can be erased.

ERASEPCR0.description: Register for starting erase of a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

ERASEUICR.description: Register starting erase of all user information configuration registers. Note that the erase must be enabled using CONFIG.WEN before the UICR can be erased.

ERASEPAGEPARTIAL.description: Register for starting partial erase of a page in code area

DURATION.description: Duration of the partial erase in milliseconds

EN.description: Description cluster: Enable channel group n

DIS.description: Description cluster: Disable channel group n

EEP.description: Description cluster: Channel n event end-point

TEP.description: Description cluster: Channel n task end-point
